body: @sajaysurya has already checked sklearn, raises issue for series-to-series, works for series-to-features (within pipeline)

The ColumnTransformer with series to series support has been implemented. The implementation is available in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/dev/sktime/transformers.py

The corresponding test in available in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/dev/sktime/tests/test_pipelines.py

I think a by-row transformer wrapper is essentially just a for loop. @mloning pointed out that this would be a bottle-neck in processing. As we are working on pandas dataframes, the inbuilt apply() function can be used; however, it performs very similarly to that of a simple for loop.

Parallelism options that I could think of are
1. joblib: we should manually split dataframes into pieces and process them in parallel and then combine. This performs reasonably well, but I don't think joblib can scale well to clusters in future. Also, we should manually split and combine dataframes.
2. dask: This automatically splits the dataframes, can work in clusters, can use big data sets from disks or networks even with very little RAM; but, this is not a drop in replacement for pandas (but very similar). It builds compute graphs and then executes it efficiently like tensorflow. This is currently promoted as a python friendly alternative for spark.

Relevant performance comparison is available at https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/dev/scratchpad/Parallel%20programming.ipynb

issue.title: Design/implementation of time series data container (pandas vs xpandas ... or sth else?)

labels.name: implementing framework
labels.description: Implementing frameworks for new learning tasks

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
As @sajaysurya pointed out, we may not at all need xpandas for the core use cases.

This is a high-priority issue to be decided by w/c Feb 4 meeting, since it the data container is a central design decision. This thread is to collect pro/con until the decision is made - issue is complete once we decide to remain with, or leave xpandas as the data container solution for the API and implement the alternative (note: in the case of leave the issue is only complete once the alternative is implemented in the existing code).

rename.from: build, or adapt functionTransformer (by-row-transformer) for series-to-series
rename.to: build, or adapt by-row-transformer for series-to-series

body: Note, as @sajaysurya has pointed out: functionTransformer is *not* a by-row transformer.

A by-row transformer has been implemented as discussed. It is available in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/dev/sktime/transformers/compose.py. Corresponding usage can be seen in the test named `test_RowwiseTransformer_pipeline()` in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/dev/sktime/tests/test_pipelines.py
Make sure output is nested pandas dataframe with series in cells.
